title: Parque Nacional Bernardo O'Higgins
description: Parque Nacional Bernardo O’Higgins is the grandest of Chile’s national parks. It covers 3,525,091 hectares—an area larger than Belgium. Created in 1969 and expanded in 1985, O’Higgins protects the Campo de Hielo Sur (Southern Ice Field), which covers over 1.1 million hectares. This remnant of the last Ice Age is a UN World Biosphere Reserve.
